rows: An estimate of actual evaluation of the future based on initial conditions. Because of uncertainties, predictions/forecasts are usually probabilistic in nature.
Simulated response of a system to potential assumptions of future conditions
Directly observable biological and physical characteristics of the land surface (e.g., forests, croplands, built-up areas)
Economic, social, and cultural purposes to which land is employed to support the various needs of human societies (e.g., food, shelter, and inputs to industrial processes)

Plausible descriptions of how the future might unfold in several key areas: socioeconomic, technological and environmental conditions, emissions of greenhouse gases and aerosols, and climate. Scenarios do not convey the likelihood or probability that the events described will occur.
